"-57462","Y","GMG290180: Outfall No. 119T/119A

Zone Protection Statement:  All hydrocarbon bearing zones will be cased and/or isolated with cement.

Mud Disposal Statement:  Drilling mud which meets EPA criteria will be returned to a mud company or disposed of at the well sight by discharging from the rig into the Gulf.					
All mud which meets EPA criteria will be caught and hauled to shore for disposal to an approved disposal sight.

"-6713","Y","A conductor wavier is being requested due to design of wellbore, whereas the 22-inch conductor to be run will be utilized as a liner and not tie-back to surface.  In order to qualify for the wavier, Stone has revised the drilling prognosis to include cementing the conductor to the mud-line, conducting a F.I.T test of the conductor shoe prior to drilling out and will log the surface hole section to evaluate that portion of the wellbore for shallow gas.  The surface casing will also be cemented to the mud-line.  See Steps 4,7 and 9 of the drilling prognosis for details. Mr. Roger Corbeille with the MMS GOMR office will be contacted and advised of this conductor wavier request."

"-212867","N","Departure request approved 3/12/2018 (attached). BP will not shut in all wells during rig skid between wells, provided there are no suspended loads from the rig over the wellbay area (BOPs, TJ, WLR) and all loads have been properly stored on SPAR. "-212935","N","Departure request approved 3/12/2018 (attached). BP will not shut in all wells during rig skid between wells, provided there are no suspended loads from the rig over the wellbay area (BOPs, TJ, WLR) and all loads have been properly stored on SPAR.  BP will shut in any adjacent producing well(s) during rig skid for BOP or riser installation where the well(s) would be at risk of impact should the lifting device fail.  NOTE: during normal BP MD drilling operations, BOPs are installed at the active well slot and then the rig moved into position over top."

"-28922","Y","1000 sacks barite and 200 sacks gel"
"-28923","N/A",""
"-28924","Y","The contingency plan for shallow gas is:
1. Kill weight mud will be maintained in the pits
2. Returns will be monitored with camera or ROV while drilling.
3. The mud pits and mud pumps will be manned during drilling.
4. If gas flow is encountered, the hole will be displaced with kill mud at maximum rate.
5. If this is not successful, enough pipe will be pulled to drop the drill string and leave the top of fish below the wellhead.
6. After the drill string is dropped, the rig will be winched to a favorable position away from the gas affected area.
7. The well will be allowed to flow until it bridges or depletes."

"-8837","Y","A conductor wavier is being requested due to design of wellbore, whereas the 22-inch conductor to be run will be utilized as a liner and not tie-back to surface. The surface casing will also be cemented to the mud-line.  See Steps 4,7 and 9 of the drilling prognosis for details. Mr. Roger Corbeille with the MMS GOMR office will be contacted and advised of this conductor wavier request."
